attributes.action: Stop selling arms to Saudi Arabia which help kill innocent Yemenis.
attributes.additional_details:
Yemen is the largest humanitarian crisis in the world, with more than 24 million people – some 80 per cent of the population – in need of humanitarian assistance.

The UN says at least 7,070 civilians have been killed and 11,205 injured in the conflict - 65% of the deaths are attributed to Saudi-led coalition air strikes.

More than 40% of UK arms exports are destined for Saudi Arabia.

The UK has helped in creating the largest humanitarian crisis in the world.
attributes.background: We ask to stop ALL license of sales of arms to the Saudi Arabian government in an attempt to stop the war on Yemen and "the largest humanitarian crisis in the world", as UNICEF describes it.
